      • Annotation

        public Annotation​(Annotation other)
        Copy constructor. This copies all attributes of the anchor except id, tracked original values (e.g. originalLabel), and attributes whose keys do not begin with an alphanumeric (by convention these are transient attributes), the intention being to create a new annotation that has the same characteristics as other (label, confidence, etc.), but which is a different annotation with different (initially, no) graph linkages,
        Parameters:
        other - The annotation to copy.

      • getAssignedOrdinal

        public int getAssignedOrdinal()
        Returns the ordinal that has previously been explicitly assigned.

        This method differs from getOrdinal() in that if setOrdinal(int) has not been specifically invoked previously, getOrdinal() will try to figure out the ordinal from the position in the parent, etc., where this method will simply return 0.

        Returns:
        The ordinal last set by a call to setOrdinal(int), or 0 if it hasn't been previously called.

      • my

        public Annotation my​(java.lang.String layerId)
        Gets a single related annotation on the given layer.

        "Related" means that layerId identifies the parent layer, an ancestor layer, a child of an ancestor, or a child layer.

        This utility method makes navigating the layer hierarchy easier and with less prior knowledge of it. e.g.:

        • word.my("turn") for the (parent) turn
        • phone.my("turn") for the (grandparent) turn
        • word.my("POS") for the (first) part of speech annotation
        • phone.my("POS") for the (first) part of speech annotation, which is neither an ancestor nor descendant, but rather is a child of an ancestor (phone.my("word"))
        • word.my("who") for the speaker
        • word.my("graph") for the graph
        • word.my("utterance") for the utterance, which is neither an ancestor nor descendant, but rather is a child of an ancestor (word.my("turn"))
        • word.my("corpus") for the graph's corpus, which is neither an ancestor nor descendant, but rather is a child of an ancestor (word.my("graph"))

        setGraph(Graph) must have been previously called, and the graph must have a correct layer hierarchy for this method to work correctly.

        Parameters:
        layerId - The layer of the desired annotation.
        Returns:
        The related annotation (or the first one if there are many), or null if none could be found on the given layer.

      • list

        public Annotation[] list​(java.lang.String layerId)
        Gets a list of related annotations on the given layer.

        "Related" means that layerId identifies the parent layer, an ancestor layer, a child of an ancestor, a child layer, or a desdendant layer.

        This utility method makes navigating the layer hierarchy easier and with less prior knowledge of it. e.g.:

        • word.list("turn")[0] for the (parent) turn
        • phone.list("turn")[0] for the (grandparent) turn
        • word.list("POS") for all (child) part of speech annotations
        • word.list("phone") for all (child) phones in a word
        • turn.list("phone") for all (grandchild) phones in a turn
        • phone.list("POS") for the all (peer) part of speech annotation, which are neither ancestors nor descendants, but rather children of an ancestor (phone.my("word"))
        • word.list("who")[0] for the (grandparent) speaker
        • word.list("graph")[0] for the (great-grandparent) graph
        • word.list("utterance")[0] for the (peer) utterance, which is neither an ancestor nor descendant, but rather is a child of an ancestor (word.my"turn"))
        • utterace.list("word") for the utterance's (peer) words, which are neither an ancestors nor descendants, but rather are children of an ancestor (utterance.my"turn"))
        • word.list("corpus")[0] for the graph's (child of grandparent) corpus, which is neither an ancestor nor descendant, but rather is a child of an ancestor (word.my("graph"))

        setGraph(Graph) must have been previously called, and the graph must have a correct layer hierarchy for this method to work correctly.

        Parameters:
        layerId - The layer of the desired annotations.
        Returns:
        The related annotations, or an empty array if none could be found on the given layer.

      • getAnnotations

        public java.util.SortedSet<Annotation> getAnnotations​(java.lang.String layerId)
        Access the child annotations on a given layer.

        This method returns a new collection, with the annotations re-sorted by ordinal, on each invocation.

        Parameters:
        layerId - The given layer ID.
        Returns:
        The child annotations on the given layer, or null if layerId is not a child layer.

      • ordinalMinimum

        public int ordinalMinimum​(java.lang.String layerId)
        The minimum ordinal for the given child layer. Used for when a fragment includes only some of the children of a parent (otherwise their child ordinals would be forced to start at 1).
        Parameters:
        layerId - The child layer ID.
        Returns:
        The minimum ordinal for the given child layer, whic defaults to 1.

      • setOrdinalMinimum

        public void setOrdinalMinimum​(java.lang.String layerId,
                              int minimumOrdinal)
        Set the minimum ordinal for the given child layer. Used for when a fragment includes only some of the children of a parent (otherwise their child ordinals would be forced to start at 1).
        Parameters:
        layerId - The child layer ID.
        minimumOrdinal - The minimum ordinal for the given child layer.

      • getAnchored

        public boolean getAnchored()
        Determines whether the anchors have offsets or not.
        Returns:
        true if both #getStart() and #getEnd() anchors have non-null offsets, false otherwise.

      • includesOffset

        public boolean includesOffset​(java.lang.Double offset)
        Determines whether the annotion's start/end offsets surround the given offset - i.e. whether the annotation t-includes the offset.

        A precondition is that the annotation's graph is set.

        Parameters:
        offset - The given offset.
        Returns:
        true if getStart().getOffset() ≤ offset < getEnd().getOffset(), false otherwise.

      • includes

        public boolean includes​(Annotation other)
        Determines whether this annotation t-includes the given annotation. Returns true if this annotation includes the other annotation's start and end offsets.

        NB If the start and end offsets of other are the same as the end offset of this annotation (i.e. other is instantaneous at the end of this annotation), this method will return false.

        A precondition is that the annotation's graph is set.

        Parameters:
        other - The given other annotation.
        Returns:
        true if the other annotation's duration is wholly included within this annotation's duration, and false otherwise.
        See Also:
        includesOffset(Double)

      • includesMidpointOf

        public boolean includesMidpointOf​(Annotation other)
        Determines whether this annotation includes the midpoint of the given annotation.

        NB If the start and end offsets of other are the same as the end offset of this annotation (i.e. other is instantaneous at the end of this annotation), this method will return false.

        A precondition is that the annotation's graph is set.

        Parameters:
        other - The given other annotation.
        Returns:
        true if this annotation includes the midpoint of the given annotation, or if they share start/end anchors (even if there are null offsets), false otherwise.

      • distance

        public java.lang.Double distance​(Annotation other)
        Determines the offset difference between this annotation and another - i.e. the minimum distance between any of the anchors. If the annotations overlap, the returned difference will be negative, with a magnitude corresponding to the degree of overlap.
        Parameters:
        other - The given other annotation.
        Returns:
        The minimum distance between any two of the annotations' anchors, or null if any anchors are unset.

      • getMidpoint

        public java.lang.Double getMidpoint()
        Determines the offset halfway between the start offset and the end offset.

        A precondition is that the annotation's graph is set.

        Returns:
        The offset halfway between the start offset and the end offset, or null if either anchor or offset is null.

      • getDuration

        public java.lang.Double getDuration()
        Determines the duration of the annotation - i.e. the difference between the start offset and the end offset.

        A precondition is that the annotation's graph is set.

        Returns:
        The duration of the annotation, or null if either start or end anchors or offsets are null.

      • tags

        public boolean tags​(Annotation other)
        Determines whether this is a tag of the given annotation (or vice-versa), i.e. whether the two annotations share start/end anchors.
        Parameters:
        other - The given other annotation.
        Returns:
        true if the start and end anchor IDs are the same for this and the other annotation, false otherwise.

      • includingAnnotationsOn

        public Annotation[] includingAnnotationsOn​(java.lang.String layerId)
        Finds all annotations on the given layer that include this annotation. This uses includes(Annotation) to determine inclusion. Annotations marked for deletion are ignored.

        A precondition is that the annotation's graph is set.

        Parameters:
        layerId - The given layer ID.
        Returns:
        A list of annotations on the given layer that include this annotation. This uses includes(Annotation) to determine inclusion.

      • includedAnnotationsOn

        public Annotation[] includedAnnotationsOn​(java.lang.String layerId)
        Finds all annotations on the given layer that this annotation includes. This uses includes(Annotation) to determine inclusion. Annotations marked for deletion are ignored.

        A precondition is that the annotation's graph is set.

        Parameters:
        layerId - The given layer ID.
        Returns:
        A list of annotations on the given layer that include this annotation. This uses includes(Annotation) to determine inclusion.

      • midpointIncludingAnnotationsOn

        public Annotation[] midpointIncludingAnnotationsOn​(java.lang.String layerId)
        Finds all annotations on the given layer that include the midpoint of this annotation. This uses includesMidpointOf(Annotation) to determine inclusion. Annotations marked for deletion are ignored.

        A precondition is that the annotation's graph is set.

        Parameters:
        layerId - The given layer ID.
        Returns:
        A list of annotations on the given layer that include this annotation's midpoint. This uses includesMidpointOf(Annotation) to determine inclusion.

      • tagsOn

        public Annotation[] tagsOn​(java.lang.String layerId)
        Finds all annotations on the given layer that tag this annotation - i.e. where start and end anchors are shared. Annotations marked for deletion are ignored.

        A precondition is that the annotation's graph is set.

        Parameters:
        layerId - The given layer ID.
        Returns:
        A list of annotations on the given layer that tag this annotation.

      • getFirstCommonAncestor

        public Annotation getFirstCommonAncestor​(Annotation other)
        Determines the first ancestor annotation this annotation has in common with the given annotation. This may return the graph itself, if there are no earlier common ancestors. "Ancestors" is inclusive in the sense that if either annotation is an ancestor of the other, it will be returned.

        A precondition is that the annotation's graph is set.

        Parameters:
        other - The other annotation.
        Returns:
        The first ancestor annotation this annotation has in common with the given annotation, or null if graph is not set or the graph is not complete enough to find the common ancestor.

      • getAncestors

        public java.util.LinkedHashSet<Annotation> getAncestors()
        Returns a list of ancestor annotations (parent, grandparent, etc.).
        Returns:
        A set of ancestor annotations, ordered by distance from this annotation (i.e. parent first, then grandparent, etc.).

      • getAncestor

        public Annotation getAncestor​(java.lang.String layerId)
        Returns the ancestor on the given layer.
        Parameters:
        layerId - The layer of the returned ancestor.
        Returns:
        The ancestor on the given layer, or null if there is no ancestor on that layer.

      • getEarliestDescendant

        public Annotation getEarliestDescendant()
        Returns the descendant annotation with the earliest start anchor, excluding tag layers (layer where Layer.getAlignment() == Constants.ALIGNMENT_NONE) and non-included layers.

        Assumes that the annotation's graph has been set.

        Returns:
        The highest descendant annotation with the earliest start anchor, or null if there are no descendants.

      • getLatestDescendant

        public Annotation getLatestDescendant()
        Returns the descendant annotation with the latest end anchor, excluding tag layers (layer where Layer.getAlignment() == Constants.ALIGNMENT_NONE) and non-included layers.

        Assumes that the annotation's graph has been set.

        Returns:
        The highest descendant annotation with the latest end anchor, or null if there are no descendants.

      • getInstantaneous

        public boolean getInstantaneous()
        Returns whether the annotation is formally instantaneous or not - i.e. whether or not its start anchor and end anchor are the same.

        NB If the anchors are different but their offsets are the same, this method will return false.

        Returns:
        true if #getStartId() equals #getEndId(), false otherwise.

      • maxPairedDistance

        public java.lang.Double maxPairedDistance​(Annotation other)
        Determines the offset difference between this annotation and another - i.e. the maximum distance between the start and end anchors - MAX(ABS(this.start-other.start),ABS(this.end-other.end)). If the annotations overlap, the returned difference will be negative, with a magnitude as defined above.
        Parameters:
        other - Annotation to compare to.
        Returns:
        The maximum distance between starts and ends of the annotations, or null if any anchors are unset.

      • createTag

        public Annotation createTag​(java.lang.String layerId,
                            java.lang.String label)
        Tags this annotation with the given tag.
        Parameters:
        layerId - The layer ID for the tag.
        label - The layer for the tag.
        Returns:
        The tag annotation created.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A string representation of the object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.util.AbstractMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object>
        Returns:
        A string representation of the object.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(Annotation o)
        Compare two annotations.

        If both have the same parent, they're compared by ordinal.

        Otherwise, if they're both on the same layer, they're compared by parent.

        Otherwise, they're compared by id.

        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Annotation>
        Returns:
        A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this annotation is before than, equal to, or after the specified annotation.
